intro: Tristania albens, commonly known as the white tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Tristania albens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
